snippet: Democrats had predicted that President Obama would be outgunned on ads by Mitt Romney, but the president, at least for now, has the advantage.
abstract: Pres Obama has steadily outspent Mitt Romney on advertising in swing states since the nominating conventions, upending popular notion that his rival would be the better-financed candidate.

byline.original: By JIM RUTENBERG and JEREMY W. PETERS
byline.contributor: Jim Rutenberg reported from Denver, and Jeremy W. Peters from New York.

lead_paragraph: Democrats had predicted that President Obama would be outgunned on ads by Mitt Romney, but the president, at least for now, has the advantage.

headline.seo: Obama Outspending Romney on TV Ads
headline.main: Obama Outspending Romney on TV Ads
headline.print_headline: Obama Camp Outspending Romney On TV Ads
